materials.raw_text: Aluminum (Al): 180 g, Cobalt (Co): 60 g, Terbium (Tb): 10 g, Yttrium (Y): 30 g

sourcing.instructions: Aluminum: Local metal supplier or online metal distributor; Cobalt: Specialty metal supplier; Terbium: Rare earth metal supplier; Yttrium: Chemical supply stores or online.
steps: Aluminum: Local metal supplier or online metal distributor; Cobalt: Specialty metal supplier; Terbium: Rare earth metal supplier; Yttrium: Chemical supply stores or online.

1. Weigh out 180 g of aluminum, 60 g of cobalt, 10 g of terbium, and 30 g of yttrium using a precision scale. 2. Place the aluminum in a clean mixing container. 3. Gradually add cobalt while stirring consistently. 4. Incorporate terbium and yttrium into the mixture, ensuring even distribution. 5. Stir the mixture thoroughly until homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 180 g of aluminum, 60 g of cobalt, 10 g of terbium, and 30 g of yttrium using a precision scale. 2. Place the aluminum in a clean mixing container. 3. Gradually add cobalt while stirring consistently. 4. Incorporate terbium and yttrium into the mixture, ensuring even distribution. 5. Stir the mixture thoroughly until homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture into a suitable crucible. 2. Heat in a high-temperature furnace to 800째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the metals.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture into a suitable crucible. 2. Heat in a high-temperature furnace to 800째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the metals.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally. 2. Once the temperature drops below 200째C, remove the crucible from the furnace. 3. Allow the sample to cool to room temperature in a dry, ventilated area for 4 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally. 2. Once the temperature drops below 200째C, remove the crucible from the furnace. 3. Allow the sample to cool to room temperature in a dry, ventilated area for 4 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder or sanding tool to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating to enhance durability and appearance.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder or sanding tool to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating to enhance durability and appearance.
